dateOptions.desc: Date range options you want to appear in the table. Hours are paired together near each other to form a range, so you should order them incrementally. You can get a so called list with ex.: later.js

titleClass.desc: Class of the header text when not using QHeader

notAvailableText.desc: Floating badge shown on rows that has isActive = false

chipEnabledColor.desc: The color of the chip when the date is enabled. can be a quasar color, or hex

chipDisabledColor.desc: The color of the chip when the date is disabled. can be a quasar color, or hex

dateClass.desc: The QChip class holding the dates

selectedClass.desc: Class of QItem when the date is selected

tblHeaderColor.desc: The text color of the table header. All quasar colors work

listDark.desc: Specifies dark theme for the QList

smallChip.desc: If true, then QChip wont take up a whole row

centerChip.desc: If true, the QChip will be centered

noChip.desc: If true, no chip will be rendered, just a simple text

header.desc: If true, the table will have a QHeader

tableClass.desc: The class for the uppermost container

helpMsg.desc: If you are using a header, this message will be displayed when the user hovers over the question mark
